result.execSummary:
The defendant Leslie M. Dorshorst-McKenzie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leslie M. Dorshorst-McKenzie

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Leslie M. Dorshorst-McKenzie appeared, pro se    Defendant finalized  waiver of  right to an attorney after full colloquy

Pre-trial conference at 07-07-2015 10:15 am.
Status conference at 07-30-2015 01:40 pm.
THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY
Defendant is not to have violent, abusive or otherwise disorderly contact with J.D.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:40 pm.
